definition: variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)

sentences.english: She’s always grousing about the work-load.
Does she always dress that badly?
sentences.chinese: 她总是穿得那么邋遢的吗？

sentences.english: Every time we sit together talking, Ququ is open to speak his mind.
sentences.chinese: 每次我们坐在一起聊天的时候，蛐蛐总是畅所欲言。

sentences.english: He was always excited by his life and busy with where it was going.
sentences.chinese: 他总是为他的生活而兴奋，忙着它要去的地方。

sentences.english: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一样，你的屈尊俯就总是让人感激。

sentences.english: Tears are sometimes rolling down from your cheek whenever thinking of the past painful hardship and hurting experience.
sentences.chinese: 每当想起过去痛苦与伤心，眼泪总是潸然流下。

sentences.english: She was embarrassed when they kept telling her she had a genius for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是对她说她有数学蠢才，她觉得很不好心思。

sentences.english: He always optimistic and genially treats the others.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐观的，并且和善地对待别人。

sentences.english: Its always warm in spring, hot in summer and cold in winter.
sentences.chinese: 它总是温暖的春天，夏热冬冷。

sentences.english: Enlightenment, it seems, always comes from an earnest study of the Word of God.
sentences.chinese: 启迪似乎总是从恳切地研究上帝的道而来。

sentences.english: The pranas are always moving, and the mind is ever-changing as well.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸总是运动的，思想也总是千变万化。

sentences.english: The pranas are always moving, and the mind is ever-changing as well.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸总是运动的，思想也总是千变万化。

sentences.english: But people are always coming late to operas .
sentences.chinese: 不过人们总是很迟才来看歌剧。

sentences.english: Always get along long before he discovered the great wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 总是相处很久才会发现他的大智慧。

sentences.english: Why can't we always say the solution is X = A inverse B?
sentences.chinese: 为什么“解为X=A逆，B”不总是正确？

sentences.english: Rhizomes consistently short necked, culms always forming a single clump.
sentences.chinese: 一贯的根状茎短颈，秆总是形成一片单个的丛。

definition: but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
usually/in many cases/more often than not
